body_html:
It's not a bug, it's a problem of your system, which probably ran out of shared memory. You can try to resize the shared memory file system as described e.g. in here. You can check the size with df -h /dev/shm.

Please try these steps, and reopen the issue only if this doesn't help you.
body_text:
It's not a bug, it's a problem of your system, which probably ran out of shared memory. You can try to resize the shared memory file system as described e.g. in here. You can check the size with df -h /dev/shm.
Please try these steps, and reopen the issue only if this doesn't help you.
body:
It's not a bug, it's a problem of your system, which probably ran out of shared memory. You can try to resize the shared memory file system as described e.g. [in here](http://www.walkernews.net/2010/05/04/how-to-resize-devshm-filesystem-in-linux/). You can check the size with `df -h /dev/shm`.

Please try these steps, and reopen the issue only if this doesn't help you.
